channel.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:20, topic:413804”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=515772.msg3748768#msg3748768 date=1315874504]
America is full of retards, and getting dumber by the minute(dumber is a word in my dictionary -.-).
[/quote]And all the other countries are not…? You’re either making a very large overstatement or are just as brainwashed and misinformed like the ‘retards’ you blame the people in the USA to be[/quote]
Not all other countries… China for one, has a lot of smart Asians.

Read full topic
item.source: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

Frell:

I don’t see why you haha. For the most part were like everyone else except for our super rednecks, fat idiots, and our retarded celebrities.

Exactly

Read full topic
item.source: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:413804”][quote author=Frell link=topic=515772.msg3748739#msg3748739 date=1315873038]
Well for the most part our accent sounds neutral
[/quote]

“Our” accent always sounds neutral to “us”, can’t that be said by everyone in the whole world? I’ve never met a person who feels like they have an accent?

That said, I’ve heard that the “Ohio” area accent is the most neutral american sounding accent, and that is what most national TV news reporters around the country try to sound like. Accents are weird.[/quote]

Not particularly. Americans typically are less aware they are speaking with an accent, whereas other countries are more aware. It’s just not in our culture to realize we are speaking with accents, too.

Read full topic
item.source: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Don’t think I agree. You’re right that there is a lot of American-like accents in music, but I think that has more to do with the impact American culture has had on the rest of the world than any sort of neutrality of the accent.

Mainly because it depends on style. Like, pop music is often American-sounding vocals, but then almost all britpop/indie rock type stuff has regional british accents, because there’s more of a sense of britishness in that music.

First two things that come to mind:


Haha, now the scottishfags are gona complain that I called them British :>

Read full topic
item.source: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:413804”][quote author=Frell link=topic=515772.msg3748739#msg3748739 date=1315873038]
Well for the most part our accent sounds neutral
[/quote]

“Our” accent always sounds neutral to “us”, can’t that be said by everyone in the whole world? I’ve never met a person who feels like they have an accent?

That said, I’ve heard that the “Ohio” area accent is the most neutral american sounding accent, and that is what most national TV news reporters around the country try to sound like. Accents are weird.[/quote]
I like to think of our accent as neutral because when people with other accents sing they sound like us. We pronounce the R and dont tip our t’s like say the British accent does, and when brits sing they don’t do that either.

Read full topic

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Frell:

Well for the most part our accent sounds neutral

“Our” accent always sounds neutral to “us”, can’t that be said by everyone in the whole world? I’ve never met a person who feels like they have an accent?

That said, I’ve heard that the “Ohio” area accent is the most neutral american sounding accent, and that is what most national TV news reporters around the country try to sound like. Accents are weird.

item.title: The world still thinks Americans are "coolest": poll
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I’m sorry Americans, but your accent really does sound “stupid” to us Or me, at least. Obviously I know theres tons of smart Americans, but the sound of the actual accent itself sounds … like a slow kid.

I love you all really.

If it makes it fairer, I think the middle class rumbly tumbly todger British accent is shitty too. :>

Read full topic
